snippet: Liliane Daoud, a Lebanese-British journalist who was sent to Beirut, Lebanon, in June, is one of many people who say they have been barred from the country....
abstract: Egyptian activists say around 500 people have been deported, barred from travel or detained temporarily at Egyptian airports since Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi assumed control of country in 2013; increase in deportations points to lengths Sisi will go to to discourage dissent.
lead_paragraph: Liliane Daoud, a Lebanese-British journalist who was sent to Beirut, Lebanon, in June, is one of many people who say they have been barred from the country.

headline.main: Egypt’s Latest Tactic Against Critics: Block Their Movements, or Deport Them
headline.print_headline: Egypt Using Deportation to Silence Its Critics

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
